page.title: 01Gazetteer of Stockton Parish
page.content: The parish of Stockton, of which Norton is the largest settlement, lies in a mixed farming belt of East Shropshire.The village lies 9 km. north of Bridgnorth, & 40 km.from Shrewsbury,the county town.The parish has a population of 327 living in 102 dwellings.Norton is a nucleated settlement,with the main core along the A442 road,with further buildings along Village Road,Windmill Lane & Cheswardine Lane.It is an agricultural community,containing 8 farms,& most employed people in the village work on the land or for Apley Estates. The remainder are commuters.Norton has a general store,a sub Post Office,a public house, a primary school,a village hall & St. Chads Church.
